title: Can classical music increase your IQ? - Quora

response.answer_text: Classical music may or may not increase your IQ but it definitely expands your range of thinking. Whether you are listening, composing, or playing classical music your mind can be relaxed, excited, or doggedly determined. If your IQ doesn’t expand it surely rattles the cage. When I wanted to improve my fingerpicking technique, I bought some classical music books. When I could play simple Bach tunes I felt that my brain was expanding. My fingerpicking technique improved immensely and my fear of classical music evolved into a thirst for the art. I am by no means a great guitarist but classical music gave an alternate playground for my mind. I didn’t go for an IQ test to see if my IQ increased but the experience definitely shook the status quo of my complacency. I had to play some rock and blues until my mind settled. Good question!

Classical music can do something much, much better than increase your “IQ.” It can develop your sensitivity, your emotional capacity, and response to the deepening presence of the spirit that lives as our companion and connects us to the other world where thought and feeling merge.
Let us not mix up cause and effect here. Having a correct IQ helps to appreciate classical and modern music, not the other way round.
